newsitem.title: UK: UK cash grains easier, trade sluggish - May 12.
newsitem.headline: UK cash grains easier, trade sluggish - May 12.

text.p: UK cash grains were mostly easier on Monday but trade was sluggish.
Brokers said volatile futures were keeping participants away form the cash markets.
"Everybody is trading futures, but there is no cash market business to back it up," said one broker.
Hardly any feed wheat trade was reported on the delivered market.
New crop Oct/Dec in East Anglia trade at 102 stg while in Devon 101 stg was paid.
Milling wheat 11 percent protein in Liverpool fetched 121 stg for July.
Barley in the Avon four range traded at 94 stg for May and 95.50 stg for Jun while in Oxfordshire 93 stg was paid for May and 94 stg for Jun.
On the fob market brokers were quoting May at 94, Jun at 95, Oct/Dec at 99, Jan/Mar at 101 and Apr/Jun at 104 stg a tonne value with no trade reported.
